intro: Hieracium steinvoldense, commonly known as the Steinvold hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in Argentina and Chile. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing a low-growing, mat-forming habit. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its yellow flowers bloom in clusters. Hieracium steinvoldense is adapted to withstand harsh conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
